I would definitely recommend this camera, especially for anyone who plans to take their camera outside, drops their camera a lot, or just anyone who is clumsy or has kids playing with their kids a lot.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera worth every dollar!!
Reviews.Author: Picture Mom
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to use. The picture quality is amazing. You cannot go wrong purchasing this camera. I take a ton of pictures and this is my favorite camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera- until it breaks!
Reviews.Author: lovestoshop
Reviews.Content: After being taken in the water 3 times, it broke.  My husband and I took this camera to the Caribbean for his mid-deployment R&R; from Iraq, and on a snorkeling trip midway through the trip, bubbles started coming out of the camera and it died. We had it replaced by Amazon, and ordered another one, thinking it must be a fluke since it was marketed as a waterproof camera. The replacement camera lasted several months, since we didn't take it in the water much. On the third time it was in the water again, big surprise...it broke! Bubbles started coming out and the camera was dead. Needless to say we will NEVER be buying another Olympus camera again. The pictures were not great anyway, and even with red-eye reduction people's eyes were always red. It looks nice and it water resistant enough that it's good for skiing for maybe getting splashed a little, but if you're looking for a truly waterproof digital camera that can handle snorkeling or the beach, look elsewhere. Unless you only want to take it in the water twice, in which case you might be okay. I couldn't be more disappointed with this camera and the complete lack of interest shown by the seller (Beach Camera) and Olympus. I won't be doing business with either company again. If it's not going to hold up to water use, it should not be sold as a waterproof camera, period. This same model camera has broken on vacation twice and left me without a camera for the remainder of my trip- I won't let that happen a third time.

Reviews.Title: Durable camera, poor picture quality
Reviews.Author: v02110
Reviews.Content: Got the camera to take on kayaking, hiking and other trips. It is waterproof and small but after using Canon SD850IS could not accept no real image stabilization. Zoom is useless, almost no sound on video. Eventually, replaced it with Panasonic DMC-ZS3 and, later, ZS7. I'd rather get a waterproof case if necessary and get a 12x zoom and great HD video.I have to clarify: I like to get posters printed sometimes, 20x30. No problem with Canon or Panasonic, no way with this Olympus. And you never know when you get a good shot, so I don't want to take a chance with Olympus. Also, with Panasonic, I stopped carrying my HD camcorder, ZS7 takes care of everything.

Reviews.Title: Bad Buy
Reviews.Author: Da Mama
Reviews.Content: Loved the size, quality, look.  Feature were good, most you don't need.Was waterproof...until you hit any kind of mineral water.  Mineral springs, ocean, etc.  The dials on it immidiatly froze up.  Needed a screwdrive to turn the feature dial.  Rediculous.  Olympus wouldn't fix or replace due to water damage...Uhhhh it's a waterproof camera... You should cover that.  Never used it again.  Waste of money.  SHould have bought a good camera and a cheap disposable water camera.  cheaper.

Reviews.Title: Good Pic, Excellent Durability, POOR Battery
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a trip to hawaii- Pictures are pretty good. Underwater pics good. Take it out and experiment with it before you use it on vacay. It has POOR battery life- VERY short, which is a big drawback. It also has a pretty poor zoom, but thats to be expected from the technical specs.Overall its an ok purchase, but you can do without the underwater pics and get better vacay pics with other cameras.

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT Camera!
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Diatz
Reviews.Content: I bought this specifically for underwater usage. It is great! It takes amazing photos, crystal clear. I would highly advise getting this over any other underwater camera.

Reviews.Title: Great for family
Reviews.Author: K. Crow "Story Mama"
Reviews.Content: My kids love this camera!  They can take it almost anywhere and just point and shoot.  I love it, because it is so small and easy to use.  We have enjoyed it very much.

Reviews.Title: Bad quality for little light
Reviews.Author: Angela Valle
Reviews.Content: This camera is good for under water pictures, but it's not good as a regular camera at all. Sony is so much better if you compare quality of images.I wouldn't suggest this camera to anyone. It takes really bad pictures with low light... it has to be sunny and bright for good pics.

Reviews.Title: Its Waterproof dude!
Reviews.Author: Tecride
Reviews.Content: Ive had this camera for a few years.  Takes decent pictures not the best but I like it for the durabilty and water use. You basically dont have to worry about it, it takes a lickin.I love using it in the water and everyone always freaks out because they don't realize its waterproof.  Then I tell them that all camera's are and they try jumping in the pool with their camera and their camera gets totally destroyed and then I say, 'just kidding'

Reviews.Title: Camera Case
Reviews.Author: Bassim Nawaz
Reviews.Content: You can get better value and quality with its price however it is good camera.

Reviews.Title: Third time in the water and it leaked!
Reviews.Author: D. Smit
Reviews.Content: I thought this thing was awesome and didn't fear taking it anywhere with me. Even lost it in a creek while tubing and found it behind a rock under the water in a rapid. But, my hopes are dashed. Took it snorkeling and somehow it filled with water! Everything was closed on it and there wasn't any sand in the seals! Oh well. Might give the deeper water version a try if the reviews look better, but seeing how it's apparently not covered for water damage, why risk it?

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: cindy "cindy"
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome camera. This seller is awesome too. Very quick delivery and personal attention regarding the best payment method for me. Great experience!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great camera!!!  Hard to complain at all.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take snorkeling and had it in the ocean 4 days with no problems whatsoever.  In Roatan, I had it submerged for 3 hours straight and had no problems.  The person who said they got water in the camera from taking it out in the rain must have got a bad one.  The underwater pictures are really good.  They won't be as clear as pictures in the diving books, but they will be highly printable.  I have pictures of a sea turtle that look like they are from a book.  I also used the camera to take alot of underwater video.  These look nice even on a 36" TV.  They get a bit grainy when blown up that big, but for the price, they look amazing.I also used this camera at a concert and got fantastic shots.  I used it on and off for the entire 2.5 hour show and had no problem with battery life.  I just bought a second battery for it to take on my next snorkeling adventure, only because once you swim with this camera, you won't want to swim without it even for a minute.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Lorna R. Kirkpatrick
Reviews.Content: A great camera you can carry with you and not worry about dropping it or getting it wet.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera, love it, love it, love it
Reviews.Author: Melisha
Reviews.Content: Love this camera sooooo much. If I had follow other negative reviews I would have never purchase this camera. I then said to my self, that's other people reviews. I will take my chances and see. I am so happy I did. Excellent camera. Go OLYMPUS!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Love the camera but the water seal failed
Reviews.Author: Tim O'Reilly
Reviews.Content: I've had the camera about two years. Just went swimming with it in Italy, and the water seal failed, frying the camera. I don't think I was anywhere near 10 feet underwater at any point. Really disappointed.  Otherwise, I've loved the camera. (P.S. I have the black model.)

Reviews.Title: Olympus 850 SW
Reviews.Author: Maddie-Nic
Reviews.Content: I had a predecessor SW camera for 5 years; this one is better.  Ive taaken a number of flower photos; close up focus was great.As always it takes awhile to learn all the menu and functions.

Reviews.Title: The best camera I have ever owned
Reviews.Author: Scott Sylvan Bell "Entreprenuer"
Reviews.Content: I use a digital camera every day at work to show my clients what is happening to parts of their home. I also use the camera for personal use.The screen is big and shows a clear picture. There is also a great video recorder for shooting video not only on land but in the water. I spend 3 days straight in the ocean snorkeling off Oahu (Hawaii) and did not have one problem shooting a picture or taking a video in the water or on the land. I did push the camera to its limits shooting video while jumping off a 30 foot cliff at Waimea Bay into the ocean several times. The camera shut off at impact when jumping off the rock. I checked the seals after the jump and there was not any water that passes into the USB or the battery compartment.The camera is small and compact and comes in a bunch of colors.2 drawbacks as mentioned the camera uses an XD card but there is an adapter where you can use a Mini SD and as mentioned the battery life is not the longest so you may want to pick up and extra battery that comes with a car charger they are easy to find on the internet.

Reviews.Title: Cool blue and so much fun
Reviews.Author: Christine ""Turbo""
Reviews.Content: Easy to operate. Easy to charge. Slim and fits anywhere. Kids love it as well. Still learning as I go but its fun and easy to follow the directions. I recommend it to pals who also have a tendency to drop things, especially near & around H2O.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for what it is
Reviews.Author: MEW
Reviews.Content: As just a camera, I don't think it's super amazing.However, as a camera that is very portable, and is waterproof/freezeproof/shockproof/dustproof, I think it's great. This isn't what you'd use to shoot your cousin's wedding, but it's absolutely perfect for any outdoor adventure involving extreme locations or extreme climates.It doesn't hurt that I got this when it was on sale for $160...can't say I'd pay $200+, simply because most of my photography doesn't require an extremely durable camera. But it's definitely great to have along on tubing trips, skiing trips, and anything I attend with only my back pockets for carrying.

Reviews.Title: Waterproof?!
Reviews.Author: H. Adamson "oneshiny1"
Reviews.Content: This camera worked great for 3 months, it even survived a couple bad falls. But the minute that I tried to take it out in a rain storm it decided to stop working after the 3rd picture.When I got home I opened the battery compartment thinking that it just needed to be charged...and a bunch of water came out. It ruined my memory card with all the pictures too.and they say it's supposed to withstand 10ft of water?!

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera... Can go anywhere!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: D. Dow "kayakgrl1964"
Reviews.Content: I shopped around for quite a while before I decided to pruchase this camera.  I read all of the reviews I could find and Looked at sample pictures and videos that are on youtube.comI was mostly looking for something that I could take kayaking and not have to worry if it gets wet.  I have submerged it in salt water to take pictures of kelp.... just to see how it worked. It was awesome. This camera has not let me down yet.  The battery life is amazing.  I have not had the occation to shoot much for video with it but I am looking forward to my sons school concerts to give it a shot.Over all I would highly recomend this camera for easy of use,durability and quality of pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great Daytime camera but poor performace in low light
Reviews.Author: Gregory L. Bizzoso "Greg B."
Reviews.Content: I've owned this camera for just over a year now and am very pleased with it for the most part.  Small enough for any pocket, but very durable.  Waterproof and shockproof features are outstanding.  The picture quality is excellent when you are outdoors with plenty of natural light.  Bring this camera indoors and especially in low light situations and you have another story.  The flash is completely out of balance, meaning you'll either wash out your subjects or be left with grainy, fuzzy, and red eyed results.This is a great back up camera and as an alternative to lugging a big SLR around Disney World, but leave it in your pocket for indoor photography.

Reviews.Title: Love it! Kinda want two!
Reviews.Author: Denise M. Barrett
Reviews.Content: This camera is AMAZING. I highly recommend it to active people looking for a strong, great camera. The picture quality is awesome, especially using the "shaky hands" feature, or whatever it is actually called. I'm a teacher, so taking pictures of my students is tough, because they're pretty darn quick. But I manage to get perfect pictures, indoors and out, just about every single time. The underwater feature is a blast, you get unbelievably clear pictures, and such a cool effect! I've taken it to the bottom of pools to get my students diving in, how cool! I've also dropped it about a million times, and letting my students use it hasn't broken it either. Highly highly highly recommend. Cool colors too! Yellow is actually orange though.

Reviews.Title: Great Durable little Camera
Reviews.Author: Kristen Peerman
Reviews.Content: This camera is wonderful. I purchased this camera after having a Nikon fail and they failed to honor the warranty.  I wanted a rugged little camera to take places and this camera lives up.  The picture quality is great, not as good as my Canon XSI DSLR but still very good.  The thing that sells this camera is durability and good quality pictures.  I love doing adventurous things and taking pictures.  Well this camera goes places that I would not dare to take my DSLR.  I have taken this camera to the amusement park and water park.  I have taken a video going down the waterslide.  I have also been able to great pictures of my daughter in the pool from a few feet away.  I also have placed a lanyard on this camera so that I can even let my 4 year old daughter take pictures with this camera.  I have not purposely dropped it or had it drop yet but it does take normal wear and tear which the Nikon did not.  The battery life could be better but just buy 1 or 2 extras and you should be fine.  I look forward to going to Disney this November and see what shots my daughter will take with this.  She has taken some interesting shots so far to see the world through the eyes of a 4 year old.  This is very nice rugged camera that takes very good pictures.  I am so glad that others gave this a good review as I am relying more on what others say about things when I go to buy them.  I always first look at Consumer Reports then check out the Amazon reviews before buying something these days.

Reviews.Title: A great Camera
Reviews.Author: R. Boettcher
Reviews.Content: Olympus Stylus 850SW 8MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom (Blue)  The 850SW is the third Olympus camera I purchased and has proven to be the best.  The previous 710 had an expandable lens which proved to be not very durable.  Rather than have it repaired a second tine I replaced it  with the 850SW.  It is durable, takes terific pictures, operates quickly and mainly is compact.  The cost dictated the blue color which I don't believe has and bearing on the performance of the 850SW.  I have not used it under water and don't intend to except if by accident.

Reviews.Title: On the go camera!
Reviews.Author: Daisy "Daisy"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera about 3 weeks ago, because I accidentally dropped my previous camera and it broke. The camera I had before that, I accidentally spilled champagne on it during a New Year's celebration and that camera died too... So when my sister told me about this camera (she has an orange one), I knew I had to get one!  And I am so glad I did!! A week after I purchase this camera I took it with me on a zip-line tour in Whistler, B.C. and I wasn't the least worried about accidentally dropping it or having water spash on it.  It is absolutely awesome!! I am very pleased with it.  The only reason I did not give it 5 stars, is that the zoom is not the best quality and there is a delay between taking pictures, so when taking action pictures, you might miss some of the sequence.  Other than that, for the price I paid $169.00 I am extremely happy with it! It is a perfect on the go camera for people with an active lifestyle!I also purchased the red-float strap and I am also very glad I got that too, so I won't worry about my camera falling to the bottom of the ocean when I am snorkling or worry about it when I am kayaking or at the pool.  I am also considering buying an extra battery.

Reviews.Title: Did not work as said
Reviews.Author: Jeremy
Reviews.Content: Had this camera for about 4 trips out.  While it did take pictures in the water it also allowed water in after only the 5th use.  The front lens now fogs up and I have made sure to always follow the directions.  Really hope I can get it fixed as it was very awesome while doing what it was supposed to.  Now it will power on but the seal must be broken somewhere causing me problems.  I would love to buy this camera if it worked but it did not.

Reviews.Title: A must for outdoor adventuring
Reviews.Author: G. Collier
Reviews.Content: Very cool camera!  Put it down the neck of your wetsuit and paddle out worry free, or in the outer pocket of your ski jacket on a cold powder day, or snap some pics then toss it on the floor of the raft-This camera has so far stood up to all the abuse I can put it through.Picture Quality:  Takes great pictures, really amazing outdoor pics and really good indoor pics.  Panorama picture quality is not as good but certainly not too bad.  Auto function seems like it takes great pictures, but having all the different shooting modes is fun to play with-(again, Auto takes pictures in the right mode anyway it seems).  Awesome underwater pictures as long as there is some light on the scene.  Not real good underwater pics if the sun is down, or if you shoot in the shadow of the river bank.  The little LED light may help that, but I'm yet to try.Video seems to be good- the sound is a little low.  Could be a little disappointing if you're a real video snob.X-D card- I haven't had a problem with this, even though I though I would.  Doesn't seem like a reason to shun this camera.  2 GB card has been plenty of room for tons of pictures, and loads of about 10 second videos.Battery life:  Hasn't been an issue.  Low battery indicator seems to come on a bit early, but even when the low battery indicator comes on there's still a lot of juice left.Other good points:Great to have a lens cover that retracts automaticallyFast!  Hardly any lag time with the shutter buttonScreen is bright and easy to see even in the sunIt just feels tough-like it won't break (and it won't) if you drop it.A bit of advice:Get a clear cover for the LCD screen.  Mine got a little scratched up after a bunch of rides being in my bike shorts pocket with some grit.  Or store it in a little sac or case, although just whipping it out of your pocket to take a quick picture is nice.Examining the gaskets just prior to entering the water and blowing off any sand that may have gotten in there is a good idea.Get a bright color camera so you can find it on the floor of the raft, or river bed.

Reviews.Title: Take it for a swim or drop it on a rock... it'll still work!
Reviews.Author: CandysRaves (and Rants) "CandysRaves"
Reviews.Content: We got this camera a year or more agao as a replacement for a previous Olympus SW we misplaced. I simply cannot say enough good about this series. You can do some pretty rough stuff with this camera and simply does not stop working. Throw it in the pool, throw it against the wall... it's all good!Okay, seriously though...First the bad... the indoor picture quality is not all that great. It's "okay", but really, don't bother with indoor. Um, that's it for the bad qualities.The good... you can take underwater photos and they turn out pretty darn good. You can take it in the pool, to the beach. Toss it in your beach bag, where the lounge chair fall on it, no problem. It's shock-proof, water-proof and basically kid-proof. I have some expensive camera equipment, but I don't worry for a single second about handing this to ANY kid and letting them snap away. They won't break it, it seems to be impossible to break.The outdoor photos are STUNNING. The color quality is top notch for this class of camera. My photos from the pool are gorgeous, the ones for the beach are absolutely amazing. A birthday party outside for a 2 year old? Beautiful.This is a great vacation camera - the only one we take on vacations (we live in Texas, it's all about the water when we go on vacation anyway). It's small enough that I can toss it in my pocket and if I sit on it, it will be fine :)I cannot recommend this highly enough, folks. Seriously, get one if you have kids and wish you didn't have to worry about getting some expensive water housing for your existing camera or you worry you'll get your current camera wet. Just buy the thing. At [...]currently, you can't afford to say no :)

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: R. Berman "rb"
Reviews.Content: This camera is a wonderful small camera that takes great pictures and is easy to use.  Can use underwater which is loads of fun.  Awesome for traveling and around town.

Reviews.Title: Great Little camera for all types
Reviews.Author: Gina Gagliano
Reviews.Content: I have always loved Olympus cameras and the great photos they capture. I needed to replace a 5 year old Samsung (I needed a new battery and just could not get it anywhere). I was looking into the new Fuji WP, but I kept coming back to this great camera. Of course I would have loved to get the more expensive version of this camera, but it was too far out of my price range.I had bought a blue version of the 850 a few months back for my mom (when they came out with the newer version). And I fell in love with the camera and all it's scene setting and ease of use. This pink one will now be hers and I'll be taking the blue one.Even though I'll have to buy an xD card (all my other cameras have SD) I still couldn't see myself buying the less expensive Fuji. The pros of the Olympus outweighed that of the Fuji.I love the macro options with the little LED to help light up a subject. I've always found that a flash overexposes any macro shot and the LED gives you light without blowing a picture out.The Fuji and Olympus are both waterproof, but the Olympus is shockproof. A major plus if you use it in water and have slippery hands when exiting a pool.This past weekend I tested the camera out in a coy pond using the video setting. It took some awesome clips of all the fish swimming around. I have yet to try it out in our pool, but I am anxious to experiment :D8mp is also quite enough for point & shoot pictures. The Fuji has 10mp, but what's 2 more mp when the human eye only really sees at 3? Besides, anything I take with this camera isn't going to be printed out much larger than an 8x10...a 3mp camera even prints up a nice 8x10.I still have yet to use many of the scene settings on this camera and using such things as the in-camera red-eye removal program.Overall this is a great little point & shoot with style and versatility.

Reviews.Title: great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Sarah A. Tompkins "Sarejina"
Reviews.Content: I liked this camera so much I now own 2 of them! I am a total beginner as a photographer and as a computer user.  I am learning how to work the camera and to take better pictures, and the camera actually helps me do this! Of course there is a user's manuel in English, French and Spanish as well.Not only did I manage to take pictures and videos, but I also managed to figure out how to get them onto my computer and then to upload them onto my facebook page.One of the best things about this camera is that it is kid safe! I can let my 11 year old snap away and if she drops the camera on land or in water (and she has done that before) I know the camera will survive.I am going to be a loyal Olympus buyer from now on, as I become more skilled at photography, I am just going to keep buying more Olympus cameras.

Reviews.Title: Best Value
Reviews.Author: Teri Campbell
Reviews.Content: We looked everywhere and this is the best price. Far better than any other price we saw. The camera is very good quality and amazing how you can use it underwater.

Reviews.Title: Olympus Stylus 850SW
Reviews.Author: A. Howard
Reviews.Content: Good little camera. Battery life is very short so get extra batteries. Easy to use and takes fairly good pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great Vacation Camera to Take Anywhere
Reviews.Author: J. Hamilton "My Opinion"
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a canyoneering trip down Orderville Canyon and Zion Narrows in southern Utah.  I had the camera in and out of water for most of the trip; no problems with the camera whatsoever and the pictures are excellent considering this is a point and shoot camera.  It actually does have a large assortment of modes to compensate for back lighting, etc.  For the most part the camera is very intuitive to learn and I can't say enough about its ability to perform under extreme conditions.  With the initial charge the battery only lasted for about 25 shots and 4 or 5 videos but on the subsequent recharges it went up to 200 or so shots including 10 to 15 two minute videos.

Reviews.Title: this camera is great for all ages !
Reviews.Author: Mar "Marinera"
Reviews.Content: i got this camera because my daugther wanted it badly. but i got the sw1050 in stead. and very dissapointed in the bad quality picture return back. i got this one and the pictures are so nice and colorful sharp and good. my 9 year girl is really happy. she takes it to school when the teacher haves picture day and video tapes her friends and the video is very good. it even haves music ! she loves it.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Susan F. Woods
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for the price. I am so glad I went on and purchased it. I LOVE the color. I received so many comments on the color of the camera, but that's not why I bought it.The pics are fantastic, but movies are great and the color and clarity of the pics and movies are wonderful.I just loved the fact that I could go from beach to water without a underwater housing unit. I've  been reviewing all the pics and movies I took and they are really quite good.If you are considering buying this camera, don't hesitate, it's a great buy for the money.I took this camera on a cruise and took pics and movies all day. I even bought an extra 2 gb card because I was afraid I'd run out of memory, but I never did.Again, great pics, great movies, above water and underwater. Get this camera, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: OK, but not great
Reviews.Author: W. King
Reviews.Content: I didn't realize this camera took xD cards. Ugh. To get good movie mode, you have to buy M+ xD cards. M+ xD cards max out at 2GB, limiting the movies you can make. Given that this camera is for water use, I don't want to be swapping out memory cards in the water!Also, the power recharger is a corded model. I'm probably just spoiled with Canon and Panasonic cameras that have a recharger pack that just plugs right into the wall. No cords.Will not buy Olympus again, but for a used camera just over $100 that can get wet, it was pretty much my only choice.

Reviews.Title: Works as a vacation camera, but water gets in!
Reviews.Author: J. Fournier "JF4"
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a vacation camera so I don't have to worry about it getting roughed up or wet at the beach (I was always paranoid about getting my "good" Sony camera wet).  I am very pleased with its performance.I already had a couple of xD cards from an old Olympus camera, and I was able to get a 1G card at WalMart for pretty cheap, so don't worry about availability of the card.  After reading some negative reviews about this camera not being truly waterproof, I decided to take "dry land" photos with one card, and then change the card for "wet" photos, so I wouldn't lose all my pictures if the camera decided to stop working.The camera has a neat setting (not the default, so you should check the manual) whereby the photos are numbered sequentially as you take them even if you change the card (rather than starting the numbers over again).  This helps you to keep your photos chronological after downloading into your computer even if you switch cards several times in one day.I took several underwater photos in the pool, which turned out really nicely. I was very pleased, as this is the first time I have ever had a waterproof camera.  At the beach, I was still leery of using it under the salt water, but I did use it to take swimming shots above the surface.Several hours after taking the underwater pool shots, back in the hotel room, I removed the battery to charge it and it was wet!!!  There were droplets of water inside the battery compartment as well as on the battery itself!  I dried everything thoroughly and left the compartment open to air dry overnight.  Everything still worked the next day, but I was pretty freaked out about water getting in.  So you should check right away after the camera's been underwater to make sure there wasn't leakage.  My battery was sitting there wet all day and I didn't know it.  I've used it for several days since, but not underwater.  I just hope this doesn't affect future performance.Read the other reviews about the battery.  You have to be careful which way you insert it.  Also, it does show the low battery light even when the battery is newly charged.  Just turn it off and back on, and the battery light will be green again.  This was a problem in my old Olympus camera too.  Battery life is not that bad.  I only had to charge it once in 6 days.It seems that you need an Olumpus M+ 1G or higher card to get a long video.  It's worth it.  I like taking videos.  My biggest beef with this camera is that you need to press the button twice before the video starts recording.  I only need to press it once on my other camera.  I missed some good action because I neglected to press twice.Overall I am extremely satisfied with the picture quality.  A lot of time the quality of the photo depends on the skills of the photographer as well as the resolution setting.  Don't blame this camera if your photos are blurry or dark.My favorite thing about this camera is the cheery yellow color.  It is perfect to take on a beach vacation.

Reviews.Title: Good point and shoot - poor quality pics
Reviews.Author: Bunny Boy
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera to keep in your pocket around town or in the boat.  But the picture quality is pretty bad.  I bought this camera because I am a student and needed to document my work. I ended up going back to my 4 megapixel digital camera because the shots I got with this camera were not good enough quality to send to my advisors.  I have owned completely manual 35mm (film) cameras and this camera severely lacks the ability to be adjusted to enhance photo quality with regards to the environment you are shooting in.  I'll probably end up ebaying this or giving to my sister so she can take it to the pool with her kids.

Reviews.Title: good buy
Reviews.Author: M. Seib
Reviews.Content: I like this camera. My only complaint is that certain settings have to be turned on in order to use all the features (such as panoramic) and the user manual does not explain this. Otherwise I'd say it's a great buy and I know lots of people who have one and are happy with theirs as well.

Reviews.Title: style with a purpose
Reviews.Author: N. Price
Reviews.Content: I bought this for our daughter for Christmas as it was on her list. It has been the best camera we have owned in our family. It has so many options its cute and it take awesome pictures. The price was reasonable and you can pick out what ever color suits your fancy...thats important to high school girls!

Reviews.Title: Great camera for its intended use
Reviews.Author: R. Coombs
Reviews.Content: This camera can take some great pictures under most conditions (low light not one of them).  If you are just looking for a pocket size camera for general use, there are better options.  But if you are looking for a waterproof camera for water sports (kayaking, canoeing, snorkling, etc) this camera can take some pretty impressive pictures.  Its scene mode offers a vast array of options, including 3 underwater options.  I had it down to 10' repeatedly and in the water for hours during a recent Caribbean cruise.  No leaks.  You will however need to turn the monitor brightness to max in the sunlight and even then I found the monitor unuseable underwater.  You just can't see it through your mask.  That said, it didn't stop me from taking some great pictures.  Just extend your arms out, point and shoot.  Relatives were all impressed with the pictures I took.  For its intended purpose, this camera works great.  I highly recommend the floating arm band option.  I used whenever I was in the water and intend to use when kayaking.

Reviews.Title: As advertised
Reviews.Author: T. Farnsworth "kermit fan"
Reviews.Content: I love my 850SW.  I have a lot of outdoor hobbies that make choosing an appropriate camera really tricky: snowboarding, endurance cycling, hiking and camping.  I wanted a camera that I didn't have to worry about in any of those situations.And, for those situations, it's awesome.  As good quality as my Nikon point-and-shoots for outdoor shots.  Completely tough.  I've taken it swimming in mountain lakes, sledding, and carried it for hundreds of miles of sweaty cycling.This is not an indoor camera, though.  Low light shots are often grainy, and I haven't had good luck with either the macro mode or image stab features.  I still get acceptable pictures, but we end up using the indoor stills from my wife's Pentax instead of this one.Heading to Cancun in June - the camera comes with me.  Snorkleing, here I come!  I'll be sure to follow the instruction manual, and turn it on and off while under running water to clean it off.  Seriously, that's what it says.  And it works, too.Mine is orange, though.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: L. Hansen
Reviews.Content: This camera and all of the Olympus Stylus SW lineup are amazing; I have used the 850, 720, and 1030 and loved them all. This can take a beating and still look nearly brand new. Only one suggestion; get one of the silicon skins to protect the finish on the front of the camera. Its a small thing, but if you are picky about looks, the skins protect the camera well. I really recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Good for price
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: I owned another Olympus which was broken and needed to replace with a simular one.  Not as happy with this one.  Takes good pictures but does not have a good zoom.  Hopefully this one will not break as easily as my other one.

Reviews.Title: OLYMPUS Stylus 850SW Camera
Reviews.Author: L. Kay Graham
Reviews.Content: What a great product!!!  It is wonderful to be able to take it into the water and not worry about it getting wet.  Have not dropped it YET, but the shock feature is a bonus, too.  It takes great pictures.  The many features are a plus, too.

Reviews.Title: Sweet, rugged, pocket camera
Reviews.Author: NWS
Reviews.Content: I picked up this little gem for travel and the holidays so I wouldn't have to carry my SLR kit and it was a perfect choice. I've had a lot of small, pocketable, digital cameras over the years but this is easily the best built of the lot. It doesn't feel like a toy or a gadget. Olympus was right to rename the series "tough", not that I tested the claims other than to take it outside on a cold day.The lens and image quality are fine for prints. Pixel peepers will find flaws but the camera wasn't intended for the gallery or pro crowd. It's a real people, real use camera. Most folks email images, toss them online, print a 4x6, or maybe an 8x10, and for that it does what it does well.Yes, XD cards are a dinosaur and they're slowly fading away. Fortunately, this camera also uses MicroSD cards. You give up panorama mode and long movie recording. In all my years I've never shot a panorama or a movie with a pocket camera. I have far better cameras for that. With a 1000+ pictures on a 4gb MicroSD card I can live with the trade off.There's been some chatter about battery life. I don't have the problem. Yes, after a bunch of flash shots the battery indicator would flash a bit. Then it stop's flashing and all is well. My guess is the battery level indicator is a bit overzealous and the battery take a bit of time to recover after heavy use. I've seen this before on other cameras.Probably the only negative is the battery charger. It's a big, slow thing with an insanely long cord. The whole thing is bigger than the camera. Swap the cord for an Apple "duck head" (used on their laptop power supplies) and the charger is a lot more compact (but not any faster). A note of caution about batteries: there are many 3rd party batteries out there for this camera - many have less capacity than the Olympus battery.Overall, a very nice, practical, take it anywhere camera.

Reviews.Title: you can do better
Reviews.Author: Madalily
Reviews.Content: I agree with the review "had high hopes" on mostly everything. The battery is the biggest annoyance to me. It doesn't last long at all. Who wants to remember to carry a charged battery with you every time you go out? With four children, I need a camera that I can grab without worrying about the battery. I had a 6 mega pixel point and shoot Nikon before this. The Olympus does take nicer pictures, but overall, I prefer the Nikon for its features. The memory card is ridiculous as you need an attachment for it to fit into the camera and another to hook it up to your computer. It's so tiny, I'm afraid of misplacing it.

Reviews.Title: GREAT
Reviews.Author: E. Badilla
Reviews.Content: well for me this is the best thing that i bought1!!the camera is perfect!!! i love that this camera has his own battery!!!also the quality of the pictures is amazing!!! well when is dark and you dont use flash the pictures look a bit foggy!!!another thing is that i bought the yellow one but the color is a bit different than the picture shows but is ok

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: Y. LUO
Reviews.Content: The camera is the exact one we wanted, water-proof and easy of use. The land photo is very good as well. Shipping was fast.

Reviews.Title: Super versatile and highly recommended
Reviews.Author: JD Irish "beautifullife"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!  I bought it to keep in my purse and as a back up to my SLR.  I end up using it more than the SLR.  I haven't tried it in the water yet, but I used it in the snow which was really cool because I wouldn't have wanted my expensive camera to get wet.  I even took it snowmobiling.  Also I let my little neices and nephews use/play with it without worrying about if they're going to drop it or chew on it :)  It has a lot of different modes to choose from, more than I'll ever use, but it's nice to just switch to a different mode in any situation without changing any settings manually.  I think the image quality is great - I haven't tried any close ups or anything like that (that's what my SLR is for).  I highly recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE THIS CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Brenna Brouillette
Reviews.Content: I gave this camera to my 11 year old for Christmas.  She loves it.  It is simple to use and has alot of features that are self explanatory.  Now we don't have to worry about her dropping the camera or getting it wet.  She loves to snorkle and we were always buying diposable cameras.  This one take awesome underwater photos.  I waould highly recommend it to anyone adult or older child.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Ashley R. Verhoff
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome! Waterproof and Shockproof...that's exactly what I need in a camera and it also takes an awesome picture. It's also reasonably priced. Great value over all!

Reviews.Title: Night mode dont work
Reviews.Author: S. K. Biche
Reviews.Content: This product looks cool but image stabilization is not good and night mode dose not work as expected rest of the stuff is really good.

Reviews.Title: Olumpus 850SW
Reviews.Author: D. Welliver
Reviews.Content: 5 stars.  Very good camera to take hunting/rafting/hiking trips. I think you do give up a little picture quality with the small lense.  Pay attention to sun angle.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!!!
Reviews.Author: SAM
Reviews.Content: This is probably the best money I spend all year! I love this camera, it is so easy to use and it makes it less stressful to have out all the time with it being water proof and shock proof. It takes great pictures and I love all the different settings. I haven't used it underwater yet but will in a few months and cant wait to try it out! I highly recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: simply what I expected
Reviews.Author: Alejandra F. Baena
Reviews.Content: I had an 4.0 mp stylus verve. It was the most perfect camera I had have.Now the stylus 850 is giving me the same satisfaction the old verve gave me. Plus all the new technology what it comes with.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera
Reviews.Author: Travis Mayfield "TravDaddy"
Reviews.Content: I love this cameara. I have always wanted a yellow camera and it has really really amamzing features. I love the fact that it is waterproof and shockprrof. I just love this thing so much

Reviews.Title: Olympus Stylus 850SW
Reviews.Author: John D. Wilson
Reviews.Content: I am completely happy with the camera. It was exactly as advertised and the company it came from shipped on time with no problems. I would recommend this camera to everyone.

Reviews.Title: Olympus Stylus 850SW
Reviews.Author: M. J. Walter "mwalter@sulross.edu"
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic camera - I've had it for two weeks now and am extremely pleased at the ease of use and especially the quality of the photos.  I bought it to use in the rains of London, when I head over there to visit my sister, but it has now become my daily carry camera and sees a lot more use than I initially expected.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME, AWESOME, AWESOME!!!
Reviews.Author: M. Stewart
Reviews.Content: This camera is a great buy!!!  It's reasonably priced, takes great pictures and is truly water-proof!  We used it a lot this summer at the beach and in lakes.  It's nice to have a good quality camera you don't have to worry about around water!

Reviews.Title: Fun Basic Camera
Reviews.Author: n/a "Susan M"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera as a fun basic camera.  It takes great quality pictures and there isn't a huge lag time in between taking pictures.  I use this as my everyday, just want to have a camera around camera.  It's light weight and fits in my purse.  This also comes with an adaptor so you can use the microSD card, which is nice since I already had a microSD card on hand.  I've already had two friends buy the camera and they love it too.  It really does work underwater, but I have yet to drop it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Arkster "Arkster the Engineer"
Reviews.Content: Great camera for traveling. Shots sometimes are fuzzy, but if you take your time and with some care, the pictures come out great.Can recommend it for casual or everyday shooter.

Reviews.Title: Olympus 850SW
Reviews.Author: Luddite
Reviews.Content: Terrific camera -- fast, great exposures, sharp macro shots.  Movies cut off after about 10 seconds, and sound is weak, but otherwise extremely competent, once you figure out all of its capabilities and how to use them.

Reviews.Title: Olympus Stylus camera- GREAT!!
Reviews.Author: D. Sac
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera I could keep in my purse, would be easy to use, could be used at the park or swimming pool and stand up to alot of abuse.  I found it!  I have used this camera underwater to get pictures of my daughter and husband swimming... totally cool.  Unfortunately, you can't see what you are taking a picture of when you are underwater, but with some good guessing, I got some pretty good shots.  My daughter loves to use it too, she is 6 and can take pictures or a movie and show those to her friends.  I don't have to worry about it getting splashed or dropped, I love this camera.  I have not mastered the lighting techniques and other parts are pretty complicated for my use, but I just ignore them.  As for the package- the tripod, the protective films, and the card reader are great!  It is easy to download to my computer.  I really like having the 2 GB card, I can take nearly 1000 pictures with it.  The Olympus battery is great, lasts for a few days at a time, the extra battery, however, only lasts for maybe 20 shots- totally not the bargain I had hoped for.  I also purchased the silicone skin- would definately recommend this- keeps the dust off the camera and gives you extra traction when taking shots near water.

Reviews.Title: Olympus 850SW This is a AWESOME  CAMERA
Reviews.Author: D. Miller "Dan Miller"
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Olympus 850SW on 8-25-08 for my trip to Sea World. I was impressed how easy this camera is to operate. This is one of the best camera I have ever had. The pictures come out very sharp and clean. I just the anti-shake option for all my pics, and everything came out clear. Shamu came out very clear as he was jumping thru the air. I love the large viewer display it was easy to see what I was taking a picture of. Even in bright light!!!!I love the fact it shock proof, water proof. so you don't have to worry about any of that kind of stuff. Even tranfering the pictures from the camera to my pc was a breeze. I highly recommend getting this camera you will not be dissappointed.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Lindsey J. Webb "L L"
Reviews.Content: I love love this camera.  Amazing photos above and below water.  so much fun to use and have.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic vacation camera
Reviews.Author: Shapattak
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera before our trip to Belize.  On the first day we were already in love with it.  It was the perfect camera to take to the beach and on snorkeling trips. We got so many more pictures on this trip since this camera could go everywhere with us.  Absolutely love this camera.I also bought the underwater housing (Olympus PT041) for my scuba trips.

Reviews.Title: perfect gift
Reviews.Author: Moris Shrem
Reviews.Content: this camera is a blast. fun and enjoyble.  pictures with an amazing quality, easy to use, its really water proof.

Reviews.Title: Everything I hoped it would be
Reviews.Author: xyz-123
Reviews.Content: WATERPROOF - Felt funny putting it underwater the first time, but I was truly impressed by the quality of the pictures. One added advantage I never thought of or heard about was rain. I was always used to protecting my camera in the rain, but now I couldn't care less!QUALITY - So far, I have taken several hundred pictures and the few disappointments have been my fault. The quality is great.EASY TO USE - Everyone in my family has taken great pictures. The menu system is intuitive and simple.ZOOM - 3x zoom is a slight drawback, but the other features make it worthwhile.MOVIE - Pretty decent. The ability to take underwater picutres is great. Nothing like taking a movie of yourself jumping in the pool and having the camera catch the action above and below water.OVERALL - I am very happy with my decision to buy this camera.

Reviews.Title: LOVE this camera!
Reviews.Author: A. Stadstad
Reviews.Content: This is a great produce.  I took it on a trip to Key West and went snorkeling.  The underwater pictures turned out great.  It also takes great outdoor pictures.  The indoor qualitly could use a little work, but overall this is a great product that I would strongly recommend!

Reviews.Title: great beach camera, especially for the price.
Reviews.Author: Patty
Reviews.Content: I got this camera to take on a trip to the Yucatan.  We did some snorkeling, but a lot of sightseeing as well.  The camera did GREAT!  I have videos of sea turtles, as well as some great shots of Mayan pyramids, monkeys, sunsets.  Last time I was on a trip to the beach, my husband and I couldn't both swim at the same time, or we were risking losing our camera.  Or, we just couldn't bring it.  Well, not any more.  We brought this to the beach, swam with it, threw it in the sand, washed it off, and it is still ticking.  It has some great features (an alarm clock with snooze that works when the camera is off was really helpful on vacation- one less thing to pack).  I was sometimes annoyed with the scene function as it is a bit tricky to switch between settings.  Also, the screen is not visible underwater (could be the light we were in).  I still got a lot of good shots, but also lost many because i didn't have it focused right.  Overall, a great, rugged camera, though it isn't perfect.  I bought the xd m+ cards, and the panorama function DOES NOT WORK to stitch the pictures together in the camera. Once i put the pics on my computer, the program did it fine, but I spent a lot of time trying to get it to work on the camera, and it just doesn't.So, if you are not a professional photographer but want a good all around camera to have pictures you can show off- this is a good one.  I met a diver from South Africa and he was very taken with this camera (and more so with the price).  Having home movies of sea turtles and manta rays is too cool- and a fun way to impress friends :)

Reviews.Title: Olympus Stylus
Reviews.Author: K. Boehmer
Reviews.Content: I needed a digital camera that is compact, easy to use and able to withstand outdoor use.  My son, who is a photographer, suggested the Olympus Stylus 850SW. It is waterproof to 10 feet (great for my snorkeling and canoe trips), easy to use, takes great pictures and is colorful and fun.  A good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: Olympus
Reviews.Author: Tara O'Brien
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for a few weeks and really love it! I have taken it to the pool with my godsons and gotten some really fun shots although not perfect clarity. I also took it to a concert and got some video. The picture was clear and the sound was surprisingly good! Overall I  am very satisfied with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Met My Expectations
Reviews.Author: M. Hernandez
Reviews.Content: I was wanting a digital camera that I could use while fishing and not be afraid to get it wet.  Not only could this camera take moisture, but it could also take some awesome underwater shots.  I even accidentally dropped it while on the boat and it didn't suffer any damage.  The picture quality is great.  I especially love the "panoramic" feature that helps you to compose easy and beautiful panoramic shots.  So far, I am very well pleased with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Almost Great
Reviews.Author: Roberto Arguello Rey
Reviews.Content: All the features are great, except battery duration, and the fact that you need to take off the battery to get it charged.

Reviews.Title: Just what I needed!!
Reviews.Author: H Dost
Reviews.Content: This camera is great, it's had good quality pictures, and I love the waterproof functionality.  I am very much a water person and I have brought it canoeing and whitewater rafting.  If you are outdoorsy at all I would recommend this simple point and shoot camera.Additionally it has a nice panorama feature that works very well in most situations.

Reviews.Title: BEST CAMERA FOR THE ON THE GO OUTDOORS PERSON.
Reviews.Author: Tahoejeepmom "Snowflake311"
Reviews.Content: My roommate had this camera and I loved it.  We could take it to the beach and get some of the best photos on our dogs in the water in action.  I should post that photo.  It could take video under water.  We could take it snowboarding and not have to worry about it.  Best Camera for the outdoors kind of person that goes everywhere. Oh did I mention the photo quality.  IT IS FANTASTIC!.  so you can't go wrong.  easy to use and so much fun.We bought this camera for out costa rica trip. It was great we took it to the beach everyday. I used it to take under water photos of fish in tied pools. It served us well. Only thing is make sure to rinse it well after every use in salt or pool water. It takes good photos and can go just about any where. Only bad thing is low light photos are a bit grainy and there is a bit of delay when taking the photos that can be annoying.All around it's an AWESOME CAMERA.  Endless photo opportunities.

Reviews.Title: very nice
Reviews.Author: Irakli Pipia "Irakli Pipia"
Reviews.Content: I am not sure why people complain about this product.  I am satisfied with the performance of the camera.  underwater pictures are nice.  and battery life is also quite fine.

Reviews.Title: Great all-weather. Low-average quality.
Reviews.Author: Daniele Tosti "lito"
Reviews.Content: Used it in all weather situations and it paid off. So much that I got two of them.Battery life appears surprisingly low. Movie's sound recording goes easily off scale. The videos keep changing brightness suddenly and without an apparent reason. The stabilized shooting is not always available. But you can shoot in torrential rain.

Reviews.Title: This camera is great except when anti shake isn't on
Reviews.Author: Laforce Baker "bakelafo"
Reviews.Content: I think this is a good quality camera for the price,but the pictures can come out a little burry when the anti shake is not on.

Reviews.Title: Love it :-)
Reviews.Author: Emily Convery "h20emmibug"
Reviews.Content: Overall great camera that is easy to use but takes great pictures in any condition!

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: C. Jones "court"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  It takes really good pictures.  Awesome for taking out on a friday night.  The underwater feature is awesome.  However, if you are looking for a better zoom feature this is not the camera for you.

Reviews.Title: durable, high tech, easy to use
Reviews.Author: J. Walton "SkaterJaydotcom"
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect father's day gift.  Take it on the boat deep sea fishing if it gets splashed with salt water or dropped on the deck, no worries.  Take it to the pool with grandkids.  Freezing conditions hunting, fishing, skiing, sledding.  With 8.0 megapixels and 3x internal zoom didn't sacrifice quality of pics and capability either.Easy to use!  My Dad can't remember how to check voice mail on his cell phone but had no problem with the self explanatory icons and point and shoot technology.  Later models like the 1030 only add technical advancement more megapixels more zoom etc.Only one external moving part the shutter cover.  Instructions actually say to submerge in fresh water to clean it before opening.  Especially after being in sandy, salty other dirty debris environments.One very durable, yet technically satisfying product!

Reviews.Title: Olympus Stylus 850SW Waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: dave
Reviews.Content: This camera is real good for the money.Takes great pictures, first time I used it I was at a lake.First time I was fishing, and tried to take pictures of the fish, latter in the day went swimming and brought the camera right in the water.With a 8MP it takes great pictures in and out of the water. I have a fly fishing guide service, and can't wait to use it on clients, and not worry about dropping it or getting wet.Got it at a good price also.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: R. Phillips
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera mainly for it being waterproof. It really is waterproof too. I've taken it with me im the ocean, lakes, and pools.  I havent really taken any underwater pictures, I just use it to take pictures of my friends and myself while we are in the water and it works great!  Ive also taken it to concerts and it takes great videos and pictures.  The only problem I've had with this camera is that the options on the little wheel selector are rubbing off so I can't see what the different modes are just by looking at it.  Overall it is an excellent camera and I'm very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great deal
Reviews.Author: A. Winston
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my son's HS graduation.  He just took it on a trip to the Bahamas, and uses it for his construction business.  It takes great pictures, and can take a beating from an 18 year old boy!

Reviews.Title: LOVE this camera!
Reviews.Author: Stephanie Ferber
Reviews.Content: Just got this camera after doing lots of researching of underwater cameras.  This camera is awesome for the price!  Love that it has a rechargeable battery and so many different shooting modes!  It's really easy to set up and get started...even my kids love using it!  Purchased a bigger memory card right away and am getting a silicone skin as well.  I've been recommending this camera to everyone!

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the price (2012 update)
Reviews.Author: G. Titus
Reviews.Content: We wanted a camera that was waterproof and shock resistant, primarily for backpacking and canoeing.  We took the camera on a 7 day backpacking trip to Isle Royale in early June and it performed very well.  It is a battery hog, tho.  A second battery was a necessity.  We used it in pouring rain with no problems and it survived the week bouncing in my pack and cargo pocket just fine.  Since then I've held it underwater taking pictures of fish as they were coming to the net, again, no problems.  Cons:  battery life, lack of manual control over shutter speed/aperture, settings options default to original on power down.  For the price, tho, it is a good point and shoot that is also waterproof and shock resistant.2012 update:  had this camera for four years now with no problems.  We've used it extensively while hiking in Alaska, the Tetons, Rocky Mtns NP, Glacier NP and canoeing in Canada:  no issues other than the markings on the function selector have become worn thru use.  The newer versions have been improved (more megapixels, HD video), but ours still takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: jvegeta
Reviews.Content: Well, got this camera last week. So far, so good. I'm happy with my purchase.Pros:1 - Waterproof, freezeproof and shockproof. Although, I'm still reluctant in trying to freeze or drop it (hey, the camera is brand new, ok?). I'll try those camera features later when I accidentally drop or use this in snow. I'm really really excited to take this to the beach. You will also enjoy watching people's reaction as you wash this under a faucet, hehe.2 - Looks stylish. I was originally going to get the 1030SW, but for me, that model looked ugly. Yeah it has more megapixels, it can go deeper underwater, crushproof,... basically, just better features. But like I said, I didn't like the style of the 1030. It looks too utilitarian. Personal choice my friend.3 - Large and bright LCD screen. I haven't tried testing the battery life under normal use. I have a habit of always carrying a spare battery.4 - The scene option is awesome. Lots of options there.Cons:1 - The camera menu system is not as intuitive. Actually, that is a problem with all digital cameras I've seen, not just Olympus. I have yet to see a menu system that is intuitive. But anyway, I digress.... The 850SW menu system takes some patience to know where and how to use every option/features. I actually called Olympus tech support cause I could not get the panorama*** option to work even though I have an Olympus brand Type M+ xD card (panorama icon was disabled in the main menu). Turns out, the camera has to be set to PROGRAM AUTO as oppose to the default AUTO. For those getting this camera, that will be useful info, and it will save you time digging through the manual (which by the way does not mention this info).2 - The sound is hard to hear when watching a video on the camera. I've read people say the video quality is not great. Well to me, it's really not a big deal, if you really want quality video playback/recording, you should not be doing that on a digital camera.***panorama feature only works if you have an Olympus brand Type M xD card. Actually, they also came out with a newer (and more expensive) card called Type M+. According to them, it is faster then the M version. Using the M+ version, you can take videos longer than 10 seconds at 30 fps (M version is limited to 10 sec at 30fps).

Reviews.Title: The Worst Camera Ever? Possibly.
Reviews.Author: Amber Norris
Reviews.Content: I have had a Canon for years. I decided to purchase this camera because I have a 2 year old daughter, and thought it would be safe, since it is so durable. I don't scuba dive or anything like that, just thought it would be fun to play with in the water. I am not a professional photographer but I do like to take nice pictures. This camera is just plain awful and I'll tell you why....Well, let me start out with the pros:1. Tthe beautiful blue color2. Of course, it does go underwater.Now for the cons:1. The photo quality is decent, at best. The photos are grainy, and blurry in most settings.2. It might as well not have a video function. They are the worst videos ever. The sound is almost not even there. This was important to me, even though I have a video camera, because this is the camera I always carry, so it is the one available in the moment when I need it.3. The software that comes with it almost crashed my computer. My computer shut down and went into some sort of DOS/Safe mode, despite reinstalling the software about 10 times.4. The vertical photos don't rotate automatically when they are transfered to the computer. I had to go in and manually change each vertical photo.5. The software is awful. It makes you put the pictures in some weird file, and is overall just worthless. It also doesn't sort out the videos from the pictures, it just mixes them all together and makes it difficult to find stuff later.6. You can't put a date stamp on the photos. (Might not matter to some, but is important to me)7. The camera, while fairly easy to use, is not set up well. There are so many different options and settings, but they are all in different places, some within other options... it is a big mess.8. Some of the functions in the camera are not available unless you use an Olympus memory card. (Which of course, I did not know when I bought a different brand)Now maybe I am just spoiled because I have had a Canon for so long, and they are the best cameras out there, but I expect certain qualities in a camera. For having 8MP, this camera has the photo quality of, MAYBE, a 4MP. It is a pretty camera, and I tried hard to like it, but it is just terrible. I returned it and purcahsed a Canon 790 for about $[...] more and could not be happier. Or course, it doesn't go underwater, but oh well. I can buy an underwater disposable for $[...] if I ever need it.THE MORAL OF THE STORY: DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA. SAVE YOURSELF THE TROUBLE OF RETURNING IT LATER AND JUST BUY A CANON NOW!

Reviews.Title: don't use for snorkelling!
Reviews.Author: Flyboy330
Reviews.Content: I bought a refurbished olympus stylus 850 and took it snorkelling in the sea. The first day it worked nicely, however image quality wasn't anyhting great. The second day water leaked into the camera, instantly killing it. I have tried a new battery, but the camera won't come to life again so for me it's a total loss. I was buying it for just that snorkelling occasion and am very disappointed. I advise anyone wanting to take underwater pictures to buy a professional housing for the camera of your choice rather than trusting the stylus 850 - it didn't work in my case!

Reviews.Title: Works great, but not in the water!
Reviews.Author: Eileen Gibson "disappointed traveler"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera with such high hopes, having planned a trip to Costa Rica that included waterfall rappelling, snorkeling, and plenty of time in the Pacific waves... The camera worked perfectly the first half of my trip, with crystal clear snapshots of scenery, people, and food.  However, the first time we went in the ocean, the camera froze up and stopped working.  Waterproof?  Definitely not.When we got it inside, I followed the instructions to clean off the camera, etc.  However, I noticed water in the LCD area, and when we opened it up, there was water in through the battery and xD slots.  Unfortunately, the camera never worked again.So I would not recommend this product to anyone who actually expects it to be waterproof. It takes beautiful photos, but isn't worth the extra money for features that aren't really there.

Reviews.Title: As advertised
Reviews.Author: R. Greco
Reviews.Content: Although I have not used the product extensively, it seems to be working as advertised.  I am an avid outdoorsmen and I will be using this camera outdoors including the extreme conditions of the winter.

Reviews.Title: bad night pictures and makes you look reallyyyy pale or really dark
Reviews.Author: D. Eck "danielle"
Reviews.Content: i really am disappointed with this. i was excited because it was waterproof and drop proof which i took as being "college proof" since i've ruined 2 cameras by either dropping them or getting them wet. however it's almost not worth the crappy pictures it takes. they're all blurry, have this weird glowy haze, HORRIBLE night picture, like absolutely horrible, and it either makes you look really really pale or really really like reddish brown depending on your skin color. i really hate this camera. maybe it's just mine?

Reviews.Title: Refurbished camera
Reviews.Author: Jack L
Reviews.Content: The camera quit working after 1 use. It was used up, not refurbished. Never buy one from them again. I have purchased several new 850SW and they all worked great. This one was supposedly refurbished. I have threw away better ones than this.

Reviews.Title: Bad product & HORRIBLE customer service
Reviews.Author: Aquitaine
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for a little over two years with only VERY gentle use. It was never dropped and doesn't have a scratch on it. It does not work for any indoor pictures that aren't close-ups as the flash is too weak. You get blurry pictures only. I went snorkeling with it twice...and it did take decent pictures under water when the battery was full (for about 10 minutes). The third time I went snorkeling the battery / camera died and never turned back on. When I tried to charge the battery I noticed it was wet. I called Olympus only to find out my $350 camera is too old even for OUT of warranty repair. Too bad so sad - it's trash after just a few uses. I suggest buying a cheap regular digital camera NOT from Olympus and a disposable under water camera. NOT worth the money!

Reviews.Title: The best camera ever!
Reviews.Author: Jennifer L. Ware
Reviews.Content: My parents gave me this camera for my birthday and I love it!  The photos and the screen are so clear.

Reviews.Title: What a piece of junk.
Reviews.Author: KissingTaco
Reviews.Content: I bought the Olympus 850SW to replace a Canon Powershot A740 and to take advantage of the Olympus underwater ability.Custom memory card (Picture card) is required for videos longer than 10 seconds.  I believe this is also the reason many photos are out of focus because the memory writing speed is not sufficient to keep up with the 8MP.Main complaints about the Olympus 850:1 -  About 40% of the pictures are always out of focus.2 -  Picture color saturation is not heavy enough3 -  Grainy pictures at 8MP is not acceptable.  At 8MP, the pictures should look as good as they do from my Canon 20D SLR.  Even the Canon A470 shot much nicer pictures.The firmware I have on the Olympus is 1.1 which is probably the only one Olympus will release.The camera's overall speed is slow.  It takes it a while to focus and then shoot.  If you try to shoot too often, say faster than 2 shots a minute, your pictures will ALL be out of focus.  I am very disappointed with this camera.The only good part of this camera is its underwater capability.  It does do that and it does that "okay".If you don't need the underwater piece, skip this piece of junk.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: A. Horton
Reviews.Content: This camera is exactly what I was looking for and I have been looking for some time now.  I have had an Olympus camera before and liked it so it was no surprise that I love this one.  I am not a person that usually likes pink but I could not resist this color either.

Reviews.Title: Camera Features Locked to OEM Memory Cards
Reviews.Author: D. Tyranowski
Reviews.Content: The camera equipment is fine...However, the "Scene" and "Panorama" modes are locked to an Olympus branded memory card.Those functions will not work without an OEM card.That is the reason for my poor rating.

Reviews.Title: Video goes "thump!" randomly and the sound quality is poor
Reviews.Author: Nadine in Austin
Reviews.Content: If you don't care about video quality, I like the waterproof-ness and the price.However, I do like taking small videos with my camera and when I transferred it over to the computer, the sound quality was poor and you have to increase your volume to hear it.. which I don't mind. But I do mind the random "thump!" noises that is recorded with the video.Also, you can't hear the video well on the camera itself. I could live with it, but the thumping noises on recorded videos is very annoying.

Reviews.Title: Real Waterproof with less Quality
Reviews.Author: Abraham Gale
Reviews.Content: I lost my previous great Konica Minolta camera after it got wet by an ocean wave, while sailing on a boat.  The Olympus camera is definitely waterproof.  I swam with it in the ocean in Kauai, and it worked.The quality of static photos is acceptable for a waterproof camera.A disappointing surprise is the software.  Since there is no view finder, if you need reading glasses, it is difficult to adjust the photo size with zoom.  You need to take a wider picture and crop. The camera let you crop... but you cannot save the cropped photo!  The camera records the date and time...  But you cannot date stamp the photo!  Things that any old average digital camera does!There are special functions with nice displayed illustrations to select that do not work, like a displayed marathon runner function to select for photographing fast moving objects.  It didn't work.  The photos of moving objects are blurred and you need to press the shutter button a few seconds in advance and pray that the object would be in the frame when the shutter open.  If you try to photo a moving car, horse or fish, you generally get an "abstract art". No mention in the booklet that you need a faster memory card, or the camera is just slow.The worst part is Customer Service.  The technician told me that it is a new camera which she didn't know and read the booklet while my cellular minutes run for 30 minutes.  Her supervisor is an expert in making you feel that you know nothing and just bother him, and didn't volunteer information, like they did in Konica Minolta (the brand does not exist anymore) when I bought their camera and called them six years ago, in order to explain how to take great, fast, date stamped, but not waterproofed pictures that I could crop and save.

Reviews.Title: stylus
Reviews.Author: G. Romig
Reviews.Content: Being in the military presents alot of opportunity to travel and you never know what your going to get into could be skydiving to diving to being in the desert doing the role that many others are afraid to do. I bought the stylus790SW  over 2 yrs ago and have taken it on deployments... aswell as jumped with it and dove with it. it is the only camera with the flexibility to withstand the abuse that it gets put through for someone on the go like myself. i highly recommend this camera to anyonw who is adventurous and doesnt want to bother worrying about his electronic items breaking at every bump. By far the best camera ive seen out that can take clean clear pictures aswell as the sheer abuse and they continue to get better. i look forward to getting the newest one in a yr or so.

Reviews.Title: Sturdy, inexpensive pocket camera takes good pictures
Reviews.Author: B. Borucki
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter because her last two cameras lasted about one year. This one can easily fit into a pocket and the electronics are well encased. The zoom is pretty good, and we are looking forward to trying out the underwater modes. I think this one will last longer if it doesn't get lost first.

Reviews.Title: Lots of Talk very little walk
Reviews.Author: C. Thomas "Chucky"
Reviews.Content: This product seriously dissapointed me, with so much talk about unbelievable clarity and outstanding photos, this camera produces photos that match just about all pocket digital cameras out there. However, where it really hurts me is in the sound and video area.  The sound quality is a crying shame. I wouldn't stamp this product as capable of shooting video, I would say it is able to takes lots of pictures quickly with static sound wrapped around it and the Very VERY faint sound of your voice screaming into the front of it. Thumbs down for me, WAY down. Also, when you pump up the resolution on the video option it only tapes for 10 seconds, cant buffer fast enough, Final straw for me, My first Olympus camera after using Canon for 5 years, and I'm going back!

Reviews.Title: Best Camera Ever!!
Reviews.Author: Angela M.
Reviews.Content: I've always wanted a digital camera and one day I went to the beach with a friend. she had this cute little camera that i thought was amazing already. we went in the water and I noticed she still had the camera so I yelled "O my God your camera"...she then informed me it is waterproof. So after finding that out, I was hooked. The icing on the cake was finding out it comes in pink!!!  I LOVE this camera!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Pass on this one
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: First time to buy internal rechargeable battery camera.  First time ski trip. First night at ski resort, wife left it plugged into the laptop overnight thinking it would charge the battery.  I left charger at home.  Battery dead by morning.  NO PICTURES from this one.  Non standard memory card, but included adaptor for MicoSD card works slowly.  Must take battery out of camera to charge.  Can't imagine buying another camera with these features.

Reviews.Title: Ok, but might not really be waterproof!!
Reviews.Author: Lynne Payne
Reviews.Content: I got this camera (although not this exact model, mine is 7.1) about 6 months ago. The pictures are not that good, lots of them are fuzzy, some are out of focus, and it doesn't take very good indoor pics, night pics, or any other pics in lighting besides natural light during the day time. Any photo that is not focusing directly on a person's face does not turn out that great. Also, when I compared the exact same picture taken on two different cameras (my Olympus Stylus vs. a friend's camera- not sure which camera, sorry), the picture on the friend's camera has MUCH better color- the people look less washed out and the colors are MUCH more vibrant on other cameras.And on a more serious note, my sister got this same camera and took it on her honeymoon. Although we had never actually tried it in water, and were hestitant, since this camera is advertised as "water-proof" she took it snorkeling. As soon as it got into the water, the camera broke, and would not take any more pics. The screen shut off, and she lost all her other pics. So they didn't have a camera for most of their honeymoon, and we are NOT happy with this camera! It should not advertise as waterproof if it really is not. I read a few other reviews who said something similar happened...although many people say their cameras work fine under water. So I would suggest you try it yours out at home first...although if it really does break when you put it in the water, tough luck, because I doubt you will be able to get a refund! We've tried!So if you are thinking about getting this camera, I would tell you, it's not a horrible camera. It takes pictures. Sometimes. But I would definitely not get it- There are cameras out there that are a lot better. Get one of them instead.

Reviews.Title: Why don't they tell you?!?
Reviews.Author: Elenor
Reviews.Content: I spent an additional $26 buying a wall charger, because what use is a rechargeable camera battery without a charger?!  The camera came today (quick shipping as usual from Amazon!) and there's a charger IN THE BOX!  Nowhere on the site does it say that the thing ships with a charger.Even if the merchant (through Amazon, but not Amazon) takes it back I'm out  the $8 S&H; for a thing I never needed in the first place plus whatever it costs to send it back!The camera is smaller than I expected, real pretty, and once the battery is charged, I'll try it out.  There are precise directions for what to do to maintain the water proofing, but they don't seem to be too onerous -- we'll see when I actually try it.

Reviews.Title: is the worst I've seen
Reviews.Author: Mauricio Galdamez
Reviews.Content: Truly the camera OLYMPUS STYLUS 850SW 8MP who buys, is the worst purchase I made, with the following:1. The image quality is the worst I've seen, no matter if it is 8 megapixels, never compared to the SONY in any of its models.2. I can not use the zoom because the blurred picture emerging, the face of people can't be distinguished. The zoom does not help at all.3. The battery lasts for only about 120 photos, the worst battery that is used in activities that I have done, I've never been able to take all the photos because the battery is exhausted.4. and for the quality of images is a camera truly expensive5. the storage capacity for the video is very poor considering that is 2 GBS,I decided to buy a OLYMPUS STYLUS 850SW 8MP that I thought it was a chamber of "excellent quality" but I never thought it wrong, AMAZON.COM could sell a product of such poor quality.My brother who is also a user AMAZON.COM wanted to buy a camera and just after seeing the quality of the photos said that it will not.Since this e-mail only what you see and not the other buyers, it would be good that the removal of its inventory sales.SincerelyMAURICIO GALDAMEZVerdaderamente la cámara OLYMPUS STYLUS 850SW 8MP que compre, es la peor compra que hice, por lo siguiente:1. La calidad de imagen es la peor que he visto, no importa si se trata de 8 megapíxeles, nunca en comparación con la SONY en cualquiera de sus modelos.2. No puedo utilizar el zoom ya que la imagen es muy borrosa, el rostro de las personas no se pueden distinguir. El zoom no ayuda en absoluto.3. La batería dura sólo alrededor de 120 fotos, batería que se utiliza en las actividades que he hecho, nunca he sido capaz de tomar todas las fotos porque la batería está agotada.4. y por la calidad de las imágenes es una cámara realmente costosa5. la capacidad de almacenamiento para el video es muy pobre teniendo en cuenta que es el 2 de GBS,Decidí comprar una OLYMPUS STYLUS 850SW 8MP que yo pensé que era una cámara de "excelente calidad", pero nunca pensé mal AMAZON.COM podía vender un producto de tan mala calidad.Mi hermano que es también un usuario AMAZON.COM quería comprar una cámara y después de ver la calidad de las fotos dijo que no.MAURICIO GALDAMEZ

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: L. Lara
Reviews.Content: I received this camera a couple of days before leaving for a month long vaction in Spain. 2 days after arriving in Spain I went online to update the firmware of the camera so that I could take longer videos. Within a minute of completing the update and making sure that the extended video function worked, the camera shut off. Thought the battery ran down so I recharged it and the camera simply will not start now. Called Olympus long distance from Barcelona and they said I had to send it in for repair. Told them I needed another camera stat and they basically said tough luck. Told them that I would need to leave a negative review on Amazon and they couldn't care less. So, if you're looking for a dependable camera, look somewhere else.

ProductInfo.Features:
8.0-megapixel CCD captures enough detail for photo-quality 16 x 22-inch prints
3x optical zoom; Face Detection
2.5-inch HyperCrystal LCD; Perfect Shot Preview mode
Waterproof to 10 feet; shockproof to 5 feet
Stores images on xD Picture Cards (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Olympus Stylus 850SW 8MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom (Pink)
